linkTarget.anchoringText: The onshore Burgan field is the world’s second largest oil field, situated in the desert of southeastern Kuwait as shown on Fig. 1. The prolific reservoir, discovered in 1938, produces approximately half Kuwait’s oil. In 2014, the operator assigned high focus on exploration and development of Burgan field to maintain production rates and explore potential geological pay zones.

image-wrap.label: Figure 1
image-wrap.caption: Kuwait Oil Fields Map –Area circled in black is Burgan Field

formatted-caption.caption-text: Kuwait Oil Fields Map –Area circled in black is Burgan Field

linkTarget.anchoringText: In the exploration well, where hybrid technology is deployed; formations characteristics were analyzed in the pre-well plan to identify potential challenges while drilling with the new bit technology. Fig. 2 shows the formations breakdown of the 22 in interval.

A cross-functional team, compromising participants from the service company’s applications engineering, research and product development, design engineering and marketing operations groups were assembled, as shown in Fig. 3.
Four wells from Burgan field have been selected as offsets, based on location, formation and footage proximity. Fig.4 shows the average performance of the 22 inch section in each well respectively.

image-wrap.label: Figure 4
image-wrap.caption: Burgan Field 22 inch Sections Offset Wells

formatted-caption.caption-text: Burgan Field 22 inch Sections Offset Wells

linkTarget.anchoringText: A chart was customized to summarize the ROP tendencies for each formation in the 22 inch section as shown on Fig. 5. The two offsets presented on this chart, Well 1 and Well 4, are the highest two ROP performances.

image-wrap.label: Figure 5
image-wrap.caption: ROP Versus Formation Chart – Red line is Well 1 and Blue line is Well 2

formatted-caption.caption-text: ROP Versus Formation Chart – Red line is Well 1 and Blue line is Well 2

linkTarget.anchoringText: In Well 5, PDC bits are a durable solution to drill the entire section using one bit. However, high vibrations are expected by drilling with a PDC, either on rotary drive or mud motor. The torque range required to drill with a PDC is higher than that for a roller cone bit. Large diameter PDC bits tend to generate high drilling vibrations and stabilizing the BHA becomes increasingly challenging. Fig. 6 Shows plotted results for torque ranges and fluctuations in a drilling simulation lab. The experiment conducted illustrates that when drilling through inter-bedded formations, at constant WOB and RPM, Torque fluctuations are a function of bit type. Roller cone tend to provide the least torque fluctuations in comparison to PDC and hybrid bits, as per the simulation lab results.

image-wrap.label: Figure 6
image-wrap.caption: Lab Simulation for Torque Ranges and Fluctuations – by Bit Type

formatted-caption.caption-text: Lab Simulation for Torque Ranges and Fluctuations – by Bit Type

image-wrap.label: Figure 7
image-wrap.caption: 22 inch Hybrid Bit Design Selected for Well 5

formatted-caption.caption-text: 22 inch Hybrid Bit Design Selected for Well 5

linkTarget.anchoringText: Drilling parameters have been thoroughly studied to conclude the recommended parameters for drilling the 22 inch section of Well 5. Fig. 8 illustrates the parameters used for WOB, RPM, mud weight and GPM by formation breakdown in the four offset wells.

The 22 inch hybrid bit achieved 30.7 ft./hr., total average ROP, increasing ROP by 142% from offsets average performance at 13 ft./hr. The drilling days chart on Fig. 9 summarizes the 22 inch section performances in Well 5 and offset wells. The gradient of the curves indicates ROP, since it’s depth over time. The steepest slope is the one for Well 5, indicating the highest ROP. Despite the fact that ROP was controlled and drilling parameters were minimized from depth 5,543 to 5,950 ft., due to fluid losses in porous formation layers.

image-wrap.label: Figure 9
image-wrap.caption: Drilling Days Chart for Well 5 and Offsets

formatted-caption.caption-text: Drilling Days Chart for Well 5 and Offsets

linkTarget.anchoringText: The hybrid 22 inch bit drilled the entire section after a roller cone clean out run to section total depth in three trips. Fig. 10 shows the depths of each trip for the 22 inch hybrid bit in Well 5.

image-wrap.label: Figure 10
image-wrap.caption: Trips Tally for 22 inch Hybrid Bit in Well 5

formatted-caption.caption-text: Trips Tally for 22 inch Hybrid Bit in Well 5

linkTarget.anchoringText: In Well 5, drilling parameters have been real-time monitored and recorded at half hour frequency intervals. Fig 11 illustrates the footage based trend of WOB, RPM, flow rate, torque in contrast with instantaneous ROP. The vertical dotted lines distinguish the three bit runs. The chart illustrates the direct relationship of WOB to ROP; the downward trend line of WOB towards run 2 and 3 is reflected by ROP downward trend.

Log data extracted from 22 inch sections of Well 5 and Well 1 have been closely formulated and analyzed. MSE was calculated using the drilling parameter logs and plotted as a customized log. Fig. 12 shows the correlation between MSE, drilling torque, ROP and formation in Well 5 and Well 1.

image-wrap.label: Figure 12
image-wrap.caption: Snapshot of drilling efficiency log at 5,000-5,300 ft. (Burgan Formation)

formatted-caption.caption-text: Snapshot of drilling efficiency log at 5,000-5,300 ft. (Burgan Formation)

linkTarget.anchoringText: Overall bit condition is rated ‘good’, given the PDC cutters have minor wear due to the presence of sandstone. Total of four cutters, in different locations on the blades, have impact damage. This is related to drilling in inter-bedded formation layers. The bit was measured to be at full diameter. The cones’ bearing were inspected and graded as ‘effective’. Given that total revolutions recorded were 600 thousand revolutions. The cone inserts have minor wear around the outer cutting structure. Additionally, the nozzles are not plugged and the depth-of-cut limiters have minimal uniform wear as shown on Fig. 13.

image-wrap.label: Figure 13
image-wrap.caption: 22 inch Hybrid dull grade after third run in Well 5

formatted-caption.caption-text: 22 inch Hybrid dull grade after third run in Well 5
